translated: In Sanskrit:

original: sam kshipta dzam bha la s'a dha nam /
analyzed: sam kshipta dzam bha la s'a dha nam /
translated: Samkṣiptajāmbhalasādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dzam bha la'i sgrub thabs mdor bsdus pa /
analyzed: dzam bha la'i sgrub thabs mdor bsdus pa /
translated: Jāmbhalasādhana in Brief

original: bcom ldan 'das dzam bha la la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dzam bha la la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Jāmbhala.

original: sngon du gsungs pa'i cho gas snying gar padma dang / zla ba la dzam yig las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa yang dag par mchod nas /
analyzed: sngon du gsungs pa'i cho gas snying gar padma dang / zla ba la dzam yig las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa yang dag par mchod nas /
translated: As previously taught, at the heart, on a lotus and moon, from the letter jaṃ arises a light ray that perfectly makes offerings to the buddhas and so forth.

original: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Then one should confess misdeeds and so forth.

original: de nas stong pa nyid sngon du bya ste /
analyzed: de nas stong pa nyid sngon du bya ste /
translated: Then, having gone for refuge and so forth, one should meditate on emptiness.

original: de la de bzhin du gnas pa'i sna tshogs padma dang zla ba la dzam las byung ba'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis sems can gyi don mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la de bzhin du gnas pa'i sna tshogs padma dang zla ba la dzam las byung ba'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis sems can gyi don mdzad nas /
translated: There, on a multicolored lotus and moon, from the letter jaṃ arises the seed syllable, which emanates light rays that accomplish the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las dzam bha la gser gyi mdog lta bu sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan can /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las dzam bha la gser gyi mdog lta bu sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan can /
translated: That completely transforms into Jāmbhala, the color of gold, with a crown of the five buddhas.

original: mdzes pa'i gos dang / rgyan gyis spras pa /
analyzed: mdzes pa'i gos dang / rgyan gyis spras pa /
translated: He is adorned with beautiful clothes and ornaments.

original: zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa /
translated: He has one face and two arms.

original: phyag g-yas na p'i dza p'u ra ka dang / g-yon na kha nas rin po che sna tshogs skyug pa'i ne'u le bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas na p'i dza p'u ra ka dang / g-yon na kha nas rin po che sna tshogs skyug pa'i ne'u le bsnams pa /
translated: In his right hand he holds a mongoose vomiting jewels, and in his left hand he holds a mongoose vomiting various jewels from its mouth.

original: autpa la sngon po'i phreng pa can /
analyzed: autpa la sngon po'i phreng pa can /
translated: He wears a garland of blue lotuses.

original: logs gnyis na rin po che'i snye ma'i char 'bebs pa'i gnod sbyin gnyis gnas pa /
analyzed: logs gnyis na rin po che'i snye ma'i char 'bebs pa'i gnod sbyin gnyis gnas pa /
translated: On both sides are two yakṣas who rain down jeweled garlands.

original: zhabs kyi 'og na gnas pa'i rin po che'i snye ma'i bum pa dpag tu med pa'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba 'khrigs pa'i bdag nyid du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: zhabs kyi 'og na gnas pa'i rin po che'i snye ma'i bum pa dpag tu med pa'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba 'khrigs pa'i bdag nyid du bsam par bya'o //
translated: Under his feet are jeweled vases with garlands, which are imagined to be the nature of a mass of light rays.

original: aom dzam bha la dza lendra ye sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom dzam bha la dza lendra ye sv'a h'a /
translated: Om Jambhala Jalenadraya Svaha.

original: zhes pa'i sngags bzlas so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags bzlas so //
translated: Recite this mantra.

original: lag pa gnyis khu tshur bcings te gung mo'i dbus su tshigs gsum pa bcag pa'i phyag rgyas snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang / spyi bo dang mdzod spu rnams su sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis khu tshur bcings te gung mo'i dbus su tshigs gsum pa bcag pa'i phyag rgyas snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang / spyi bo dang mdzod spu rnams su sbyin par bya'o //
translated: With the two hands clenched into fists, the middle fingers are bent at the third joint. With this mudra, [the offerings] are given to the heart, throat, head, and the place between the eyebrows.

original: snga bar yang de bzhin du skad cig gis bsgoms nas /
analyzed: snga bar yang de bzhin du skad cig gis bsgoms nas /
translated: In the morning, having meditated in the same way for a moment,

original: 'dis chu snyim pa brgya rtsa brgyad dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis chu snyim pa brgya rtsa brgyad dbul bar bya'o //
translated: With this, one should offer one hundred and eight water-bowls.

original: aom dzam bha la dza lendra ye dha na me de hi da da p'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom dzam bha la dza lendra ye dha na me de hi da da p'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ jambhala jalenḍraya dhanam etaṃ dehi dadapāya svāhā.

original: dzam bha la'i sgrub thabs mdor bsdus pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: dzam bha la'i sgrub thabs mdor bsdus pa rdzogs so//
translated: The concise sādhana of Jambhala is complete.
